intro: Isochilus cernuus, commonly known as the drooping bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, drooping flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem, and it produces small, cylindrical fruits known as capsules. Isochilus cernuus thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
